intro: Idiogramma microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaf idiogramma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of tiny, white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
